title: Bag Face, mid–late 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: satin, chain and knot stitch embroidery
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Cream white taffeta embroidered in colored silks. At center, a shepherd with a ham, a shepherd with a horn, a shepherd with sticks and goats. Faces, hair, hat and horn painted. Framed in a pattern of a narrow ribbon made of beau knots with flowers.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bag Face, mid–late 18th century.
mid–late 18th century. Medium: silk
Technique: satin, chain and knot stitch embroidery. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-52-14.
